image.altText: A composite image showing two parents and two young people.

props.synopsis: Four years after Greg Ireland's daughter and Magda Pearce's son were murdered at a rural SA property, the two parents have picked up a torch for their children, and will be honouring their memories in this weekend's New York Marathon.

title.children: Their children were murdered, but Greg and Magda's emotional marathon has taken them to New York

image.altText: A bottle of tablets.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in SA issue an urgent warning to hospitals and GPs after a patient who consumed a substance sold as a complementary medicine suffered severe lead poisoning.

title.children: Lead poisoning case linked to illegal 'Kamini' pellets triggers urgent health warning

image.altText: A woman in a red top addresses the media.

props.synopsis: Anti-abortion activist Joanna Howe has been barred from parts of South Australia's parliament, with the upper house's president telling the chamber she allegedly insulted, intimidated and threatened MPs on the night of a vote about late-term abortion law.

title.children: Anti-abortion campaigner banned from parts of SA parliament over alleged 'threatening' tactics

image.altText: flowers and a card laid on a fence

props.synopsis: A disability advocate says the death of a woman with "significant" disabilities and who was living in "squalid conditions" is a reminder that change is needed to ensure people do not "slip through the cracks".

title.children: 'How is this still happening?' Death of woman with disabilities prompts calls for safeguards

image.altText: A female singer jumps on a stage with a crowd in the background

props.synopsis: With thousands of artists ranging from big acts to emerging bands, the second iteration of Good Music Month will blast Adelaide and its surrounds with a plethora of live acts, culminating in the Notestock festival.

title.children: Good Music Month kicks off in Adelaide with a 'jam-packed' November to draw in punters

image.altText: A man in a orange shirt standing behind an avo tree.

props.synopsis: While cheap avocado prices might be good news for consumers at the check-out, farmers are battling oversupply but have their sights set on new markets.

title.children: Growers defy avocado glut to plant more trees for lucrative foreign markets

image.altText: Luke wears a cap and stands on a football field as he looks at the camera

props.synopsis: At the end of his playing career, this ex-footballer's debilitating headaches, memory loss and anxiety sent him looking for answers. The answer was the repeated head trauma he experienced playing the game he loved.

title.children: Former SANFL player told his brain resembles a car-crash victim's after 20 concussions

image.altText: man speaking to reporters

props.synopsis: A South Australian MP found guilty of multiple counts of deception has won a bid to postpone his sentencing — and retain his position in parliament — until the outcome of a Supreme Court appeal.

title.children: MP found guilty of deception labels SA case a 'sideshow' as sentence postponed

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: The hit-run crash death of the youngest son of South Australia's top cop gripped South Australians, who grieved the 18-year-old "widely and deeply".

title.children: The night that changed the lives of two young men and their families

image.altText: A blue and brown sign reading "Mount Gambier Courthouse" with a brick building in the back

props.synopsis: A man charged over the deaths of two children in a three-car crash involving an emu has been granted bail despite concerns from police that his mobile phone was taken from the scene and has not been found since.

title.children: Man accused of killing two children in crash granted bail despite police concerns about missing phone

image.altText: Dylan Clancy poses with a ukelele during her time in a prison music program

props.synopsis: A music program run by singer-songwriter Nancy Bates has helped female inmates survive the daily challenges of prison. Now, a documentary is putting the initiative under the spotlight.

title.children: New doco reveals how music behind bars prepares female prisoners for life after release

image.altText: Para surfer Chris Blowes and his board.

props.synopsis: Australia's best para surfers are heading to the United States for the world titles. For Chris Blowes, it represents a full circle moment.

title.children: Para surfing was key to Chris's recovery after a shark attack so he's fighting for it to be a Paralympic event

image.altText: A photo of a young women with long brown hair and blue eyes looking straight ahead with serious expression.

props.synopsis: Some votes in the US election won't have as much weight as people in some other states.

title.children: The US may be a democracy — but not every vote is created equal

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a fluoro orange vest, is seen in the cabin of a truck.

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump and Kamala Harris blitz the swing states in the final days before the US election, twin "garbage" controversies have created headaches for both sides.

title.children: How Donald Trump in a rubbish truck came to sum up US election

image.altText: With large computer screen in background, bottom half of person's face is visible facing down towards mobile phone held in hand.

props.synopsis: A new report by Our Watch has found 40 per cent of workplace leaders surveyed are unaware of their new legal obligations to prevent workplace sexual harassment. For many who experience harassment like *Jess, quitting seems like the only option.

title.children: Workplace sexual harassment is common, but many employers don't know their obligations

props.synopsis: The ATO's latest corporate tax transparency report reveals 31 per cent of companies did not pay a cent of tax. Here's the full list.

title.children: The ATO issued 124 companies with $3b in tax bills, but many still didn't pay any. Here's the list

image.altText: A man out of focus stands at a street intersection in a rural town where the road is covered in brown water.

props.synopsis: For the first time, demographers have calculated how many Australians move each year because of climate disasters such as fire, floods and cyclones. They say the figure is likely to be an underestimate.

title.children: More than 20,000 Australians move home after climate disasters each year

image.altText: Three opalised shark teeth fossils, Lightning Ridge, NSW, April 2024.

props.synopsis: In a fossil-rich pocket of northern New South Wales, two pioneering palaeontologists have spent decades digging up rare relics of the past, striking deals with collectors and opal miners, and unlocking our understanding of deep geological history.

title.children: This fossil collector may have just hit the jackpot. The only question is whether to sell or save it

image.altText: A sunrise appears over Mt Fuji in pink colours

props.synopsis: Think you've had your ears to the ground? It's time to test your knowledge of the week that was with our Friday news quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Biden's 'garbage' gaffe, Mount Fuji record, and Brisbane's bridge bash

image.altText: Tennis player Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard serves a ball.

props.synopsis: Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard stormed to the title at the Swiss Indoors in Basel, but his unique approach to serving could be a game-changer for tennis, according to one of the sport's best.

title.children: In the space of five matches, Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard may have flipped tennis on its head

image.altText: Cars are seen strewn across the median of a major highway leading to Valencia in Spain.

props.synopsis: The Spanish prime minister is urging residents to stay home as the country's weather bureau issues fresh weather alerts.

title.children: Death toll from Spanish flooding disaster jumps to 158 as further weather warnings are issued

image.altText: Elon Musk wearing a black blazer jacket over a grey t-shirt in front of a projection of the US flag

props.synopsis: Philadelphia's district attorney Larry Krasner, a Democrat, is trying to shut down the lottery being run by the America political action committee set up by Musk to support Donald Trump's election campaign.

title.children: Elon Musk fails to show for million-dollar giveaway court case

image.altText: A photograph of Adolf Hitler against a colourful background

props.synopsis: LSD is a relatively new drug, compared to many others. And its history has been influenced by some unlikely groups.

title.children: 'Fantastic pictures, extraordinary shapes': How LSD was discovered and where it all went wrong

image.altText: A white four-wheel-drive police car close-up with a white square in the middle of a silver roof rack.

props.synopsis: Defence and communications analysts worry Australia's growing reliance on Starlink presents a security threat as Elon Musk could abruptly deny access "in a crisis".

title.children: Can Australians trust Starlink to stay switched on? Analysts think our new reliance is dangerous

image.altText: Rapper Young Thug sits in between his two lawyers at his court trial dressed in a suit with his hair in braids

props.synopsis: He will be released from jail with five years commuted to time served but could be put back behind bars for 20 years if he violates the terms of his sentence.

title.children: 'I can't wait another three months': Young Thug to be released after guilty plea

image.altText: Protesters from the Freedom Convoy in Ottawa standing in front of police

props.synopsis: The report also found the more likely you are to believe in conspiracy theories, the more likely you are to accept extreme methods of protesting.

title.children: Criminal researchers say most Australians are alienated by violent protests

image.altText: A jogger runs along the shore of Manly Beach after sunrise on the first day of Spring in Sydney, 2008

props.synopsis: Australia's Pilbara region has been heating up, with temperatures soaring past 43C this week. The hot air is now starting to travel to the south-east, bringing along with it a heightened risk of fires.

title.children: BOM is predicting a hot weekend. This is where the temperatures are expected to rise the most

image.altText: Male Forty-spotted Pardalote after being monitored and released

props.synopsis: They are tiny, energetic and might be seen chasing their insect dinner in the forest canopy — that is, if you are extremely lucky enough to see one. There are fewer than 1,000 left in the wild.

title.children: This little bird could be 'gone, not with a bang, but a whimper', expert warns

image.altText: PMs courtyard, man talking, smiling

props.synopsis: You would have to be super optimistic to expect a revival in trust in the foreseeable future. But if it continues to fall away, the foundations of our political institutions and our society will become shakier.

title.children: Furore over Anthony Albanese's Qantas perks chips away at public trust in politicians

image.altText: two men cheers in front of a red background

props.synopsis: The Bank of China is on the brink of establishing a branch in Papua New Guinea's capital Port Moresby, a move that is being watched closely by the Australian government.

title.children: Bank of China is on the verge of gaining a full foothold in the Pacific — and Australia's government is watching closely

image.altText: A man stands in front of red and green indicator boards.

props.synopsis: The Australian market is on track to end its week with heavy losses, following a sell-off on Wall Street as shares of tech giants Microsoft and Meta fell sharply. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX on track for worst week since August, following Wall Street's tech sell-off

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Subdued consumer spending': Westpac's take on ABS Household Spending Indicator
ASX down about 0.6 per cent in final hour of trading
Property investors remain in market near record levels

image.altText: new hosts RN

props.synopsis: Award-winning journalist and former ABC foreign correspondent Sally Sara will replace Patricia Karvelas as host of Radio National Breakfast in 2025.

title.children: Sally Sara to replace Patricia Karvelas as host of ABC Radio National Breakfast

image.altText: Amyl and the Sniffers 2024 by JOHN ANGUS STEWART

props.synopsis: "I was starting to feel really ashamed of my big personality": Why one of our most Australian-sounding bands moved to Los Angeles.

title.children: Amyl and the Sniffers are one of Australian music's great current success stories — so why have they moved overseas?
